name: Grand Hotel Baglioni Firenze

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On our last day in Italy we returned to Florence for a last night stay. We had to get up for an early flight and were simply looking for a place to stay near the train and bus station to get us to the airport. We chose this hotel only because it had availability on January 1st and because it was right across from the train station and bus station at Santa Maria Novella. Our stay was an unexpected surprise and this hotel is a good find.
reviews.title: An Unexpected Surprise

likes.liked: — The room was unexpectedly large and the view was amazing.
likes.disliked: — The door was difficult to open.

reviews.text: First, the price on such short notice was 171 Euro (not the 250 Euro plus average on Trip Advisor). The room was actually a suite with 2 separate sitting rooms, a bedroom, and a fantastic view of the Duomo outside. So the price was a value. The bathrooms were modern and wonderful and the room had all other amenities.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay
Wonderful Hotel, perfect location
reviews.text: The hotel, itself, is charming with lots of beautiful charms like old wood accents to the halls, rooms, and lobby. The only problem was that the entry to the room door was a bit of a hassle. It reads a card and then you had to put a shoulder into it to get it to open.

The price includes an enormous breakfast buffet with fresh and tasty options from eggs, Italian bacon, to fresh fruits, pastries, yogurts, and juices. The view from the breakfast room on the top floor is spectacular.
reviews.title: Beware Baglioni

reviews.text: We really lucked out finding this place. For the weary person arriving by train...book it...it is steps away. It is also only about 4 bloack along a nice street to the Duomo and is about 2 blocks from the city market.
reviews.title: mixed Bag at the Baglioni

likes.liked: — front desk helpful, our room was attractive and large

reviews.text: The Baglioni is like an old, elegant lady, few steps from the Santa Maria Novella station (the main one in town) and 5 minutes from the Duomo.
reviews.title: Classy, solid tradition hotel in Florence

reviews.text: Wood everywhere, maybe not made today, but very well kept; it gives to this place a great charm.
reviews.title: Quaint

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You can smeel elegance on here.
reviews.title: This was a good place on balance

reviews.text: Choice the superior rooms (I think they called them De Luxe): mine was pratically a junior suite.
reviews.title: Great location. Fair Hotel

reviews.text: If you have a chance to be there in low season+weekend you can find a shocking price (in a positive way). Restaurant, where they also served the breakfast in the morning, has a view to die for! Strongly suggested!
reviews.title: Great Location
Great place for a weekend
reviews.text: I chose this hotel at the recommendation of an Italian colleague. Location is great, near the centre and train station. It was my partners birthday weekend. I had arranged for a cake and prosecutor to be in the room. They were presented wonderfully and each day the staff covered the cake, refreshed the plates and cutlery and really made the treat last. We chose a deluxe city view room. It was worth the extra money. The room was large, clean, and a very old Italian style, just what I wanted. My only complaint would be the shower, it went hot and cold a number of times during each shower. The staff were great, very helpful, and the level of English was good. Our package included breakfast. If I stayed here again I would spare the expense because as with many Italian hotels breakfast just wasn't up to scratch. Cold eggs, greasy bacon, bad toast, I should haveknownbetter. Just go for coffee and a pastry.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One cannot think of a better view on Florence. Amazing, at 360° from the terrace.
reviews.title: Great location, superb view from the terrace

reviews.text: The Baglioni is located two minutes from the Santa Maria Novella station, and ten minutes from the Duomo. Everything to visit in Florence is walking distance from the hotel.
reviews.title: Great hotel great location

reviews.text: Breakfast from the dining room is great, as is a drink on the terrace.
reviews.title: Great Place but a bit overrated...

reviews.text: The rooms are very classy, maybe a little old-fashioned but stilll very elegant.
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience

reviews.text: I booked this hotel because its conveniently located opposite of the train station and I can do my outlet shopping at "the mall" via the terminal. It's near all the attractions and shopping area and I love the facts that I can go shopping and unload my stuffs at the hotel. Staying here a couple of days and off to another stop. If this is also the reason you wanted to stay here... Better think twice! Its my worst nightmare ever!!!
reviews.title: Be WARY of this hotel!!! Dun ignore all negative feedbacks of this hotel!!! It's super not safe, i LOST my branded goods in the

reviews.text: I stayed in the suite room 204 and i lost my newly brought ( still wrapped in box and ribbon ) hermes bracelet just on the desk inside the hotel room. I'm very sure about this as I took the last picture of it at the desk area. I informed the reception and they told me the housekeeping will update their system if they found any lost items. I gave up speaking to them after getting the same answers for continuous 3 days. I tried sending multiple emails to them but they didn't bother to even reply a courtesy or comfort email back which pissed me off the most.
reviews.title: Good location, friendly staff, rooms horrible!!!

reviews.text: I always feel we shouldnt request perfection about hotels and its ok for hotels to have few mistakes and thats the reason i will not bother to write negative feedback about hotels in the past. But this time I feel I should warn all travelers especially most people travel to florence to visit their outlets store.
reviews.title: Grand, but a bit tired

reviews.text: You will expect to queue at least 20 minutes for breakfast in the morning as they have limited seats.
reviews.title: Great location, beautiful facilities.

reviews.text: The tape water smelled of heavy chlorine/rusty steel. I'm not sure whether its because of the water pipe system of Italy which was mentioned by others or is it only in this hotel cos I did not experience this in my other hotels in Milan, Venice and Rome. The smell is so bad that its better not to drink from the tape, I almost vomited while rinsing my mouth.
reviews.title: 1st night no good room

reviews.text: When I arrived, I was greated by the Manager, with a smile on his face. He checked my reservations and confirmed everything I was entitled to. The staff was beyond helpful,
reviews.title: Fantastic Place to stay

reviews.text: they made sure my stay was enjoyable.
reviews.title: Nice and Great Location
Great Hotel
reviews.text: The rooms are smaller that you can expect in america, but that is fine. My room was made up and cleaned everyday. The staff is trust worthy. One day I left 15 Euros for the house keeper without a note and when I arrived that evening, the money was still there.
When I return to Florence, I will ensure that I stay at the Grand Hotel Baglioni.
reviews.title: Florence, not for me

reviews.text: The Florentines were exceptional people, friendly and very helpful.
reviews.title: Good Central Location
A Nice Experience Overall
reviews.text: Staff friendly in all areas but most of the problems that we had were in relation to noise between the paper-thin dividing walls of the rooms.

Three out of four nights we were disturbed by noise in the next room. E.G. We could hear every word of a telephone conversation being conducted at 2am and we were awoken by a television being used at 3am.
reviews.title: Lovely!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very close to the train station which was great for us :)
reviews.title: Amazing hotel . Great location friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of the hotel is located between the main attractions (walking distance ) and great streets with amazing restaurants ( especially the restaurant called -pizzeria tiraballa ) the rooms are big and spacious with amazing open view , the rooms are very clean and the service is professional and kind with plenty of smiles and greetings . Huge HUGE beds!
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel in Fantastic Florence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The view of the restaurant is spectacular! The only thing that was out of place was the room floor which was made of wood and splinters could get into your foot... And the noise was very loud and screechy .. Especially if you don't want to wake up whom ever is with you ...
reviews.title: Honest and hospitable. English friendly. Classic beauty.

reviews.text: The bathroom was clean and the tub was huge ! Water flow was amazing and the tub fills itself in seconds.
reviews.title: A musty grand old aunt in great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recommend this hotel we enjoyed it a lot and will come back to it !
reviews.title: Excellent location and grand hotel

reviews.text: we stayed here one night when the not-so-grand majestic overbooked and bumped our reservation. this hotel is beautiful and has an excellent location. highly recommed the roof top restaurant for a good American style breakfast.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this hotel as a surprise for my partners 50th birthday.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our first impression was that it was a bit old and lacked atmosphere but in actual fact the rooms were clean and comfortable and the location was ideal for all the sights and the train station which we needed when we went on a day trip to Pisa and Siena.
reviews.title: Very Good Hotel!

reviews.text: The open air roof top restaurant was a delight and we ate there one evening overlooking Florence - the temperature was warm and the subtle lighting and flowers were beautiful.
reviews.title: Nice Room Rude Staff

likes.liked: — comfortable bed and clean very nice bathroom
likes.disliked: — hot and staff rudeness to our friends - for no reason

reviews.title: Very nice hotel
reviews.text: Our only complaint would be the hotel staff who were unhelpful and rude which is such a shame as from reading the other reviews we are not the only guests with this opinion.

The location of this hotel is great because it is right near the train station and not far from the duomo. However, there are many problems. The rooms are small and need some work. The staff was INCREDIBLY rude to me and my sister. One of the workers in particular made snide remarks about us being american. The next day i went to to talk to general manager who is a very nice man. He upgraded my room to suite which was a very nice room, however is was not worth 380 euros a night. I would definitely not recommend this hotel to anyone. There are much better hotels that are a lot cheaper.
reviews.title: Not worth the stay

likes.liked: — the restaurant, even though it is expensive

reviews.title: great hotel, great location
reviews.text: This hotel was just a two block walk from the train station - very convenient. It is old, but we really liked our room, which was like a tiny apartment with a separate sitting area and desk. The dark ceiling beams and furniture set the tone. The people at the front desk were quite helpful and the hotel was in walking distance of everything. Another plus was that we rented a car from Hertz, which had an office just a few blocks away.

My wife and I stayed at this hotel in may as part of a Colette vacation tour....it was the third hotel on our intinerary...it is located near the Duomo and the other common sight seeing spots so that is definitely a plus...as others have mentioned, the restaurant on the fifth floor looks out on the rooftops of florence and it was a nice spot for breakfast, which we thought was fairly good....our room was on the third floor and faced the train station but it was quiet and we did not notice noise from other rooms and we would have, if there was noise, since we are fairly light sleepers... the room was very clean, "old world" in that it had a armour and dark heavy furniture and a beamed ceiling...a bit on the small side but the beds were very comfortable...the bath was nice.....another reviewer mentioned that they had been robbed in the turnstile at the front of the hotel...that happened to one of our group as well and when we reported it to the hotel staff, they did not seem to care....if you go out of the hotel, take a left, go to the end of the block and then turn left(essentially behind the Baglioni), there is another hotel, the Astoria, which is very nice and we had dinner there which was quite good.....Overall, I would consider staying at this hotel again
reviews.title: Good location, nice breakfast location

description: Stylish Hotel set in converted palace, located downtown, near Conference Center & tourist attractions.
